title: Ladakh: Govt intrigued at violence even after ‘unprecedented’ vikas; fringes in focus
content: Ladakh grapples with unrest despite significant post-2019 development, including enhanced connectivity, education, and tourism, officials claim. They find it ironic given the region's progress since gaining UT status. However, the violence stems from long-standing demands for statehood, Sixth Schedule protections, and resource control, which local bodies have consistently raised, overshadowing perceived development gains.

title: FTA push: EU envoy flags missed opportunity; calls for full engagement by year-end
content: The 13th India-EU FTA round was a "missed opportunity," though both aim for a year-end deal, with another round set for October 6. Lingering issues persist, notably India's Russia ties, including energy and military exercises, which the EU views as an impediment to deeper relations despite shared strategic diversification goals.

title: New beginning? Trump, Netanyahu back Gaza peace plan; Hamas stance unclear
content: Trump's 20-point peace plan for Gaza: Gaza will be deradicalized, terror-free zone and all hostages, alive or dead, will be returned. Trump will lead a Board of Peace and a temporary government will take over Gaza. If Hamas does not reject the plan, Israel will "finish the job" and it will have Trump's full backing.

title: How Asia Cup 2025 trophy presentation turned into a diplomatic standoff
content: India's Asia Cup victory over Pakistan descended into controversy as the Indian team refused to accept the trophy from ACC President Mohsin Naqvi, citing his social media posts and diplomatic tensions. Naqvi, also Pakistan's interior minister, subsequently removed the trophy, leading to India celebrating without it. The incident escalated into a political spat between the two nations.

title: Karur tragedy: Stampede FIR names 3 of Vijay’s party; 1 arrested
content: Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam's Karur secretary Mathiazhagan was arrested Monday night, named a prime suspect in the September 27 stampede that killed 41 people. Police alleged delays, mismanagement, and chaos at actor Vijay’s rally triggered the fatal crowd crush. General secretary Bussy Anand and joint general secretary CTR Nirmal Kumar were also implicated.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on US’ H-1B visa fees hike: A great start, but...
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang has backed President Trump's H-1B visa program overhaul, hailing it as a "great start" to address system abuse. However, Huang warned that the new $100,000 application fee is prohibitively expensive, risking the deterrence of foreign talent and driving tech investment away from the US. He emphasized that attracting global talent is crucial for America's future, cautioning the high cost could disadvantage startups and impact international talent flows, while also addressing concerns about Chinese researchers.

title: Myanmar earthquake: 4.7 magnitude tremors felt across Assam, Manipur
content: A magnitude 4.7 earthquake struck Myanmar near the India border early Tuesday, causing tremors across Manipur, Nagaland, and Assam. This seismic event, centered southeast of Ukhrul, followed a 3.4 magnitude quake in Maharashtra and a 3.3 magnitude tremor in Tibet, indicating recent widespread seismic activity.

title: H-1B visa policy change: Canada PM responds to Trump, says ‘maybe we can …’
content: President Trump's significant H-1B visa fee increase to $100,000 has created a stir, prompting Canada to consider attracting highly skilled professionals. Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and industry experts view this as a "wonderful opportunity" to draw talent left stranded by the US policy, despite potential challenges within Canada's immigration system.

title: Top stocks to buy: Recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Somil Mehta of Mirae Asset Sharekhan recommends Apl Apollo Tubes Ltd and Hindustan Zinc as top stocks to buy today. Both stocks exhibit bullish flag patterns and positive momentum indicators.

title: FBI arrests four 'illegals' for aiming laser at CBP helicopter
content: Federal agents raided a Portland home following an incident where an individual allegedly aimed a laser at a Customs and Border Protection helicopter and another aircraft. All four occupants of the residence were found to be in the U.S. illegally and are now in custody.

title: Accenture layoffs: 11,000 cut; CEO says ‘we are exiting" employees we can't retrain
content: Accenture has laid off over 11,000 employees in the past three months, citing their inability to be retrained in AI skills, as it reshapes its workforce for the AI era. The company is simultaneously expanding its AI capabilities and plans to increase headcount, reflecting a broader industry trend of adapting to AI or facing obsolescence.

title: 'Gussa ho rhe ho aap': Suryakumar destroys Pakistani journalist
content: India's T20 captain Suryakumar Yadav addressed the Asia Cup 2025 final controversy where his team boycotted handshakes with Pakistan and refused the trophy from PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi. This sparked debate about politics in cricket, with Yadav facing tough questions. He later pledged his match fees to the Indian Army, as diplomatic tensions overshadowed India's tournament victory.

title: Indian aid for Palestine close to record $80m in last 11 years: Govt
content: India doubled its developmental aid to Palestine in the last eleven years. This assistance totals nearly eighty million dollars. India maintains its long-standing commitment to a two-state solution. It continues humanitarian support through UNRWA despite challenges. India has not voted against any Israel-Palestine resolutions at the UN. The nation balances ties with Israel and Palestinian support.

title: 'PM's cheques of PKR 25 lakh bounced': Pakistan player recalls getting scammed by govt
content: India's record ninth Asia Cup win in 2025 triggered discussions. Former Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal's old video resurfaced. He revealed government cheques for the 2009 T20 World Cup winners bounced. Pakistan Cricket Board refused to handle it. This contrasts with India's immediate cash prize for their squad. The incident highlights player treatment differences.

title: NFL trade rumors: Russell Wilson’s future with Giants grows more uncertain
content: Russell Wilson, benched by the New York Giants for rookie Jaxson Dart, is reportedly a trade candidate before the November 4 deadline, according to NFL insider Ian Rapoport. Despite a difficult start to the season and fan criticism, Wilson remains positive and committed to the team, publicly stating his desire to stay and support Dart.

title: Buccaneers’ Bucky Irving faces injury concerns ahead of Week 5 vs Seahawks
content: Tampa Bay Buccaneers' star running back Bucky Irving faces an uncertain Week 5 status against the Seattle Seahawks after head coach Todd Bowles confirmed an MRI. Irving's potential absence, following his explosive 165-scrimmage-yard Week 4, raises concerns for the Bucs' offense already battling other injuries. His availability is crucial for their strategy against Seattle.

title: Why comedian Heather McMahan apologized after targeting Rory McIlroy at the Ryder Cup
content: Comedian Heather McMahan faced criticism for heckling golfer Rory McIlroy at the Ryder Cup. She shouted vulgarities during his tee-off. The incident went viral. McMahan later apologized and resigned from her hosting role. McIlroy maintained composure despite the disturbance. The PGA of America increased security. This event sparked debate on fan behavior at sports events.

title: Proposed 69-km rail line between India-Bhutan designated Special Railway Project
content: Railways designated the Kokrajhar-Gelephu line a Special Railway Project. The Northeast Frontier Railway issued the notification. This 69-km line will connect India and Bhutan. The project was part of the government’s Act East policy. The final location survey was completed. This project was estimated to cost around Rs 3,500 crore. It includes six new stations, bridges, and viaducts.

title: US pharma tariffs to have limited impact in India: Govt to panel
content: The Union commerce ministry stated US tariffs on Indian pharma exports will have limited impact due to generic drug focus and similar tariffs on China. However, marine exports face a significant disadvantage from high US tariffs. India is actively diversifying export markets and pursuing FTAs to boost trade and reduce US dependence.

title: Bill to remove PM, CMs: Congress to boycott JPC; full opposition exit looms
content: Congress has decided to boycott the joint parliamentary committee vetting three contentious bills, which mandate automatic dismissal of jailed CMs and ministers. This decision follows similar boycotts by TMC, SP, AAP, and Sena UBT, potentially leading to a complete opposition no-show. The move highlights concerns about opposition unity regarding the bills tabled by Union Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: Concerned over takedowns, will appeal HC’s Sahyog order: X
content: X expressed deep concern over a Karnataka HC order empowering police to issue arbitrary content takedown notices via a new portal, Sahyog. The platform plans to appeal, arguing the regime lacks legal basis, violates constitutional rights, and circumvents IT Act Section 69A. The HC, however, dismissed X's petition, asserting Indian law and cautioning against unregulated speech.

title: BMC polls: BJP likely to play big brother to Shiv Sena; NCP to get some seats
content: The BJP is set to dominate seat-sharing in the upcoming BMC elections, with Deputy CM Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena likely to contest fewer seats. Shinde emphasized "elective merit" over numbers, indicating a strategic shift. The BJP aims for over 125 seats, confident of securing 150+ with allies, as seat-sharing talks await the reservation lottery.

title: Jiya 1st autistic female to swim across Catalina Channel in US
content: Jiya Rai, a 17-year-old Indian para swimmer with Autism Spectrum Disorder, made history by becoming the first female with ASD to successfully swim the treacherous 34-km Catalina Channel solo. She completed the feat in over 15 hours, dedicating her swim to autism awareness. This achievement adds to her accolades, including India's highest honour for young achievers.

title: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban SPLIT after 19 years of marriage: Reports
content: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban have reportedly split after 19 years of marriage, with sources indicating they've been living apart since early summer. The separation is described as "one-sided," with Kidman reportedly trying to save the relationship while Urban moved out. Speculation arose earlier when Kidman applied for Portuguese residency alone.

title: Jaz Agassi surprises fans with heartfelt Daughters Day reply to dad’s post
content: Andre Agassi will celebrate National Daughters Day in September 2025. He will share photos with his daughter Jaz Elle Agassi. Jaz will also support her father at the 2025 Laver Cup. She will appear publicly at the US Open with Parker Aquino. They will later visit Steffi Graf's hometown. These events will offer glimpses into Jaz's life.

title: UP: Wolf believed to have killed four kids found dead in Bahraich; autopsy ordered
content: A wolf, believed responsible for killing four children and injuring a dozen villagers in Bahraich, was found dead under mysterious circumstances. Forest officials rejected claims of it being shot, awaiting post-mortem results to confirm its identity and cause of death. Meanwhile, compensation was distributed to victims, and searches continue for another wolf, urging caution.

title: SC finds fault with bail orders of judges, sends them to academy
content: The Supreme Court has ordered special judicial training for a Delhi ACMM and sessions judge over faulty bail orders. They granted bail to a habitual offender couple, accused of Rs 1.9 crore fraud, who had previously reneged on promises to the Delhi High Court. The SC criticized the officers for ignoring the couple's conduct and superior court decisions.

title: Bihar: Vaishnaw flags off 3 Amrit Bharat, 4 local trains - know the routes
content: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw virtually flagged off three new Amrit Bharat Express trains and four local passenger trains, significantly boosting Bihar's rail connectivity. A ceremonial event at Patna Junction marked the occasion. Vaishnaw highlighted Bihar's fully electrified rail network and 1,899km of new track laid, with new services scheduled to commence shortly.

title: No immunity from Pocso FIR despite marrying survivor, having child: HC
content: Nagpur HC refused to quash a Pocso case against a man who married a 17-year-old and fathered her child, ruling a minor's consent is irrelevant. The court emphasized that taking a minor from lawful custody constitutes an offense, irrespective of marriage or the girl's current support for the accused. Courts must adhere to existing law.

title: Warfare measured in secs now, be ready with futuristic roadmap: Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh directs the Coast Guard to develop a future roadmap. He stresses technology integration for maritime security. Warfare now measures in hours and seconds. Satellites, drones, and sensors redefine conflict. India must use AI and machine learning to counter threats. Preparedness, adaptability, and rapid response are essential. Geopolitical events also require close tracking for readiness.

title: Bareilly tension: 38 shops sealed over ‘encroachment’; crackdown to continue
content: Bareilly authorities sealed 38 shops, mainly minority-owned, following recent clashes between police and “I Love Muhammad” campaign protesters. Shopkeepers allege the civic action is a reprisal, claiming a court stay and lack of notice. Officials, however, assert the sealing targets rioters and addresses encroachment on government land. Internet services remain suspended as security forces maintain vigilance in the city.

title: Uttarakhand: HC grants anticipatory bail in conversion case; sets conditions
content: Uttarakhand High Court granted anticipatory bail to Mohd Muntazir. He faced charges under BNS section 87 and the Freedom of Religion Act. A man accused Muntazir of kidnapping his wife. The woman later told investigators she willingly converted to Islam. She stated she now lives with Muntazir. The court emphasized personal liberty.

title: Chennai drug bust: Bollywood actor held with 3.5kg cocaine; haul worth Rs 35cr
content: A Bollywood supporting actor was apprehended at Chennai airport with 3.5kg of cocaine, valued at ₹35 crore, in a joint Customs and DRI operation. Arriving from Singapore, the actor had the drugs concealed in his luggage's false bottom. Officials suspect he was a courier for cartels, possibly destined for Mumbai or Delhi.

title: Odisha: For family needs, HC allows early withdrawal of FD
content: Orissa High Court provided relief to a woman. She needed funds for urgent family needs. The court allowed premature encashment of her National Savings Time Deposit. Postal authorities had previously denied her request. The court cited Hindu law and amended rules. It set a two-week deadline for processing the withdrawal. Funds belong to the depositor.

title: Marvin Mims Jr. injury update: Broncos WR questionable vs Bengals tonight
content: Denver Broncos prepare to host Cincinnati Bengals for Monday Night Football. Wide receiver Marvin Mims Junior is questionable due to a hip injury. His availability remains a game-time decision. Mims Junior plays a dual role as receiver and return specialist. His presence adds versatility and explosiveness to the team and with his absence, will the team be able to perform?

title: ‘Pension must be treated as income in accident claims’
content: The Punjab and Haryana High Court ruled pension must be treated as income for motor accident compensation, calling it a “deferred fruit of hard work.” The court significantly raised compensation for Manjit Kaur and her son from Rs 7.9 lakh to Rs 31 lakh, noting the tribunal wrongly ignored her late husband’s two pensions.

title: Asia Cup drama! BCCI set to lodge protest against Naqvi
content: The BCCI condemned ACC chairman Mohsin Naqvi for taking the Asia Cup trophy after India declined to accept it from him. BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia announced the board will raise a serious objection at an upcoming ACC meeting, threatening to escalate the matter to the ICC if the trophy isn't returned.

title: Ladakh row: After LAB cancels meet with Centre, MHA says 'open for dialogues' any time
content: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) affirmed its openness for dialogue with Ladakh's Leh Apex Body (LAB) and Kargil Democratic Alliance (KDA), despite LAB halting talks due to prevailing unrest. MHA cited past successes, while LAB demanded normalcy before resuming discussions.

title: Hill carted off in Dolphins' win with dislocated knee
content: Dolphins wide receiver Tyreek Hill dislocated his knee during Monday night's game and will remain hospitalized overnight, according to coach Mike McDaniel.

title: Bochy, winningest active manager, out in Texas
content: Bruce Bochy, who guided the Rangers to their only World Series championship, will not return as manager in 2026, the team announced Monday.

title: LeBron: Contract status 'doesn't bother me at all'
content: Despite being a 21-time All-Star coming off an All-NBA second team selection and playing with no long-term financial commitment from the Lakers, LeBron James said his contract situation will not affect his performance this season.

title: Kawhi: Allegations of no-show deal not accurate
content: Kawhi Leonard said that he doesn't "think it's accurate" that he performed no services for Aspiration, the now-bankrupt green banking company and Clippers team sponsor with which he signed a lucrative endorsement contract.

title: Mets to retain Mendoza; no guarantees for staff
content: After failing to clinch a playoff spot amid very high expectations, Carlos Mendoza will return as manager of the Mets for the 2026 season, the team said.

title: Sirianni: Brown's desire is to remain with Eagles
content: Eagles coach Nick Sirianni, asked about A.J. Brown's cryptic tweet following Sunday's game, said he believes Brown wants to remain in Philadelphia.

title: Bears coach regrets how TV interview received
content: Bears coach Ben Johnson expressed regret Monday over how his halftime interview during his team's Week 4 win against the Raiders was received.

title: Watson apologizes to Euros for 'rude' U.S. fans
content: Two-time U.S. Ryder Cup captain Tom Watson on Monday apologized for the "rude" behavior of fans at Bethpage Black, saying he was "ashamed of what happened."

title: The only MLB playoff preview you need: World Series odds, likely MVPs and how far all 12 teams will go
content: Have Fall Classic or bust hopes for the postseason? Here's why your squad could be playing deep into October ... or get sent home early.

title: Oregon in OT? Virginia's stunner? Bama's redemption? Ranking best games of Week 5﻿﻿
content: The heavyweight battles brought the goods, but there were even more thrillers. We rank Week 5's games.

title: How the Lynx's yearlong pursuit of WNBA title ended early in the semifinals
content: Since a runner-up finish a year ago, the Lynx focused on winning it all in 2025. Instead, they're out in the semis.

title: Caitlin Clark fuels women's memorabilia market growth
content: Sports collectibles industry experts say interest in Caitlin Clark cards is leading to growth in the women's memorabilia market overall, particularly for the WNBA.

title: 'Don't you talk s--- about Steven Seagal': MMA stars rank Hollywood actors as fighters
content: ESPN assembled a panel of MMA experts to determine which Hollywood stars would win a UFC-style event.

title: Best, worst of Week 4: Chiefs win big over Ravens, Packers tie Cowboys
content: Our NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 4.

title: Three losses through four weeks? Let's diagnose the Ravens' big problems and size up what's next
content: Baltimore came into the season with Super Bowl hopes but is now 1-3. What happened, and can the Ravens turn things around before it's too late?

title: How Europe backed Rory McIlroy's words, won Ryder Cup on the road
content: Two years ago in Rome, McIlroy predicted a win at Bethpage. Over three days, gutsy team play made it happen.

title: Inside the odds of the Guardians' remarkable comeback to win the AL Central
content: From 10.5 games back on September 1 to division champions, the Guardians defied the odds to overtake the Tigers.

title: Ranking the top freshmen so far in the 2025 college football season
content: Through five weeks, we've seen first-year players make huge contributions. These 11 players are standing out.

title: Dan Hurley on ego, Maui losses, Lakers -- and Geno Auriemma's wake-up call
content: In Hurley's "Never Stop: Life, Leadership, and What It Takes To Be Great," he writes that he reached out to Auriemma after UConn's 0-3 trip to the Maui Invitational last November.

title: Atlético Madrid serve up derby lesson, Liverpool get a wake-up call and more
content: Atletico Madrid turned back the clock to thrash their rivals in a game that will give both sides plenty to think about. Plus: Arsenal get a big win and Liverpool a wake-up call, as Gab Marcotti explains the weekend.

title: Ruben Amorim running out of excuses: The numbers don't lie
content: Soccer management is ultimately a numbers game, and none of them are adding up for Man United's manager.

title: Tracking MLB offseason manager changes: Bochy out in Texas, Baldelli and Melvin also out
content: The offseason carousel starts with openings in San Francisco, Minnesota and Texas. Here's who is out -- and who could be in line to replace them.

title: 10 moments that define 2025 Mets' epic collapse
content: The Mets nearly won a pennant last year -- and then added Juan Soto. And yet a season of promise turned into an all-time collapse.

title: Pickups: Replacing Malik Nabers, surprising RB options
content: Highlighting available free agent options after a weekend of surprising performances ahead of Week 5.

title: NFL Week 4's top performance?: Check out the fan-voted 'Himmy' Award results
content: Weigh in on Week 4's top player by casting a "Himmy" Award vote for Dak Prescott, DK Metcalf, Jaxson Dart or Puka Nacua.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: My First Bet for Week 5: Chiefs keep momentum, Lions pile on points
content: What immediately grabbed our attention once odds came out for Week 5? Here are early bets that stand out.

title: College football: Bama eyes revenge vs. Vandy, No. 3 Miami visits No. 18 FSU
content: This week's odds and FPI predictions for Miami-Florida State, Vanderbilt-Alabama and every top-25 matchup.

title: Who will make the 12-team College Football Playoff?
content: Select your favorite contender, make your picks for how its season will play out and see what the Allstate Playoff Predictor foretells.

title: MLS: Son keeps LAFC climbing as San Diego slips
content: Son Heung-Min and Denis Bouanga are dragging LAFC up the Western Conference table as well as the order in ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi clubs to return for Man City's Bernardo Silva
content: Saudi Pro League clubs want Manchester City midfielder Bernardo Silva despite failed approaches last summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Student Killed, 65 Feared Buried In Indonesia School Building Collapse
content: Rescuers ran oxygen and water to students trapped in the unstable concrete rubble of a collapsed school building in Indonesia, as they desperately worked to free survivors Tuesday morning more than 12 hours after the structure fell.

title: Iconic Gandhi Statue Near London University Vandalised, India Reacts
content: Mahatma Gandhi's statue in Tavistock Square, London, was defaced on Monday, just days before the annual Gandhi Jayanti celebrations are scheduled to take place at the site on October 2.

title: Gurugram Techie Kills Wife, Then Dies By Suicide After Telling Friend
content: The police said they got a call from Kumar's friend, who told them that he had sent him a video on Sunday at 3.15 pm saying that he was going to die by suicide.

title: 19 Killed, 21 Missing As Typhoon Bualoi Hits Vietnam
content: Vietnam's death toll from Typhoon Bualoi rose to 19 with another 21 people still missing, the government said on Tuesday, making it the most devastating storm to hit the country this

title: All About Tomahawk Missiles Ukraine Wants To Use In Strikes On Russia
content: Russia said on Monday that its military was analysing whether the United States would supply Tomahawk cruise missiles to Ukraine for strikes deep into Russia, a step that Russian officials say could trigger a steep escalation.

title: US Proposal For 'Temporary' Gaza Governance Has Roles For 2 World Leaders
content: A peace plan released by the White House on Monday to end Israel's war in Gaza included surprise roles in a post-war Gaza for two familiar political figures: former UK Prime Minister Tony Blair and US President Donald Trump.

title: PM Modi To Visit Kali Mandir In Delhi's CR Park Today
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to participate in the Durga Puja celebrations at the iconic Kali Mandir and Shiva Temple located in Chittaranjan Park (CR Park), South Delhi, on Tuesday, coinciding with the auspicious day of Ashtami.

title: Delhi High Court Stays NOIDA Authority's Rs 100 Crore Demand Over DND Flyway Ads
content: The Delhi High Court has stayed a demand letter issued by NOIDA authority, seeking Rs 100 crore from Noida Toll Bridge Company Limited, the developer of DND flyway, in alleged advertisement license fees.

title: India Announces 2 Cross-Border Rail Links With Bhutan
content: India on Monday unveiled its plan to build two cross-border train links with Bhutan at a cost of over Rs 4,000 crore, in first such railway connectivity projects with the Himalayan nation to boost trade and economic engagement.

title: YouTube To Pay $24.5 Million To Settle Trump Lawsuit Over Suspended Account
content: Alphabet-owned YouTube has agreed to pay $24.5 million to settle a lawsuit that U.S. President Donald Trump brought against the company over the suspension of his account following the January 2021 U.S. Capitol riots, a court filing showed on Monday.

title: Gandhi Statue Vandalised In London, Indian Mission Condemns Violent Act
content: The High Commission of India has strongly condemned the vandalism of Mahatma Gandhi's statue at Tavistock Square in London on Monday, just days before the annual Gandhi Jayanti celebrations are scheduled to be held at the site on October 2.

title: Final Bihar Voter List To Be Out Today, Now Over To Supreme Court: 10 Points
content: The Special Intensive Voter Roll Revision in Bihar is over and the new lists will be published today. The schedule for the election is expected to be announced next week.

title: Hamas Says Group Has Not Received Trump's Gaza Peace Plan
content: A senior Hamas official told AFP on Monday that the Palestinian militant group had not yet received US President Donald Trump's Gaza peace plan.

title: Punjab Court Asks Kangana Ranaut To Appear In Person In Defamation Case
content: A court on Monday directed actor and MP Kangana Ranaut to be present in person on October 27 in a defamation case, rejecting her plea for appearing through video-conferencing.

title: Internet Outrage Over Trump's AI Conspiracy Video
content: Donald Trump stirred online outrage Monday after posting an AI-generated video of himself promising every American access to all-healing "MedBed" hospitals, reviving a widely debunked conspiracy theory.

title: Gazans Says Trump's Peace Plan "Farce, Unrealistic"
content: Residents of war-torn Gaza expressed scepticism over the latest peace plan unveiled Monday by US President Donald Trump, dismissing it as a farce that fails to end the war.

title: Pakistan, Indonesia, Other Key Muslim Nations Back Trump's Gaza Peace Plan
content: Washington's European allies urged Hamas to accept the plan, which Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he supported as he warned the Palestinian armed group of more devastation if it did not comply.

title: Internet Blackout Hits Afghanistan As Taliban Enforce Morality Crackdown
content: An internet blackout hit Afghanistan on Monday, with local media reporting a potential nationwide cut of fiber-optic services as part of a Taliban crackdown on immorality.

title: Why was X’s ‘censorship’ challenge rejected? | Explained
content: Why has the Karnataka High Court dismissed X Corp’s petition against the Union government’s Sahyog portal? What is the function of this portal, operated by the Indian Cybercrime Coordination Centre? Has X complied with similar rules in other countries?

title: ’Union govt has imposed undeclared President’s rule in Punjab,’ says CM Mann
content: Mr. Mann was speaking on the discussion surrounding the State’s recent floods and rehabilitation during the special session of the Punjab State Assembly.

title: 2 killed, 5 wounded when man opened fire in casino parking lot in Texas, authorities say
content: Keryan Rashad Jones, 34, was arrested during a traffic stop several hours after the shooting late September 27 night at the Kickapoo Lucky Eagle Casino in Eagle Pass, authorities said

title: Tharoor flags concerns over Air India Express plans to curtail Kerala flights
content: Any curtailment of services at this stage will inevitably cause severe hardship to migrant workers, students, tourists and families, while also hampering trade and tourism, Shashi Tharoor says

title: UPSC finalises panel of three officers fit for appointment as T.N. DGP
content: Once the panel is received, the State would have to immediately appoint one of the officers as a regular DGP/HoPF with a minimum tenure of two years in compliance with the Supreme Court order.

title: Sociology student from Mumbai wins Srinivas Rayaprol Poetry Prize 2025
content: The prize, including a citation and cash award of ₹15,000, will be presented on October 25, marking the birth centenary of Srinivas Rayaprol.

title: ‘Fulfil poll promise on granting affiliation to Haryana schools’
content: The BJP had in its 2014 Assembly election manifesto promised that after forming the government, unrecognised schools would be granted one-time permanent affiliation by easing the norms

title: CSL expands CSR footprint into community-driven agriculture projects
content: CSL to back three major agriculture projects related to precision farming, including revival of a sprawling paddy field, installation of weather monitoring systems, and setting up a climate-resilient paddy processing unit

title: HC seeks to stop police from leaking alleged confession statements of accused to media
content: Even if in certain circumstances portions of such statements are made public, the police should clarify that they are not admissible as evidence against the accused in a criminal trial, said a Division Bench of Justice A.K. Jayasankaran Nambiar and Justice Jobin Sebastian

title: The RSS is a ‘ten-headed Ravana that represents regressive tendencies’: Congress leader
content: The ten faces stand for regressive tendencies like anti-constitutional behaviour, anti-religious attitudes, and anti-democratic actions. The destruction of these will be the real Vijayadashami

title: Karur stampede: TVK district secretary picked up for police inquiry
content: TVK’s Karur West district secretary V.P. Mathiyazhagan is named as accused number one in the FIR registered by the Karur Town police.

title: Watch: PM Modi urges citizens to back Indian products: “Say with pride – this is Swadeshi!”
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the new Delhi BJP office on September 29 during Navratri celebrations. In his address, he praised the NDA’s governance model, highlighting improvements in security, anti-corruption, and public savings. He cited increased tax exemptions and GST reforms that benefit common citizens. PM Modi also called on BJP workers to promote Swadeshi products with pride, encouraging every shop to display a bold sign reading, “Say with pride, this is Swadeshi.”

title: Uttar Pradesh on unstoppable path under CM Adityanath’s leadership, says Union Minister Goyal
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal praises Uttar Pradesh’s growth under Yogi Adityanath, highlighting safe business environment and investor-friendly policies

title: European envoys raise ‘Russia question’ amid deepening India-EU ties
content: EU Ambassador Herve Delphin says India buying Russian oil and its participation in Zapad military exercise worry Europe; he says it has to ‘square’ Russia partnership with desire to deepen ties with Europe

title: Palaniswami terms probe panel ‘eyewash’, calls for CBI investigation
content: Contending that the people will not trust the government investigation, the former Chief Minister says, “For the people to know what really happened and to ensure justice, an investigation by the CBI should be ordered.”

title: Ahead of bypoll, over 4,000 voters added in Ghatshila Assembly constituency under Special Summary Revision in Jharkhand
content: Number of male voters in the draft publication was 1,23,314 and female voters’ number was 1,28,050; this has now increased to 1,24,899 and 1,30,921 respectively, in the final publication

title: Last rites of two more protesters held in Leh amid restrictions, curfew continues
content: Educational institutes remain closed, mobile Internet services are suspended; several pockets of Leh town, especially where the main government offices are located, continue to be barricaded with concertina wires

title: Paper leak protest called off after Dhami promises CBI probe
content: Vexed with the recent paper leak in the Uttarakhand Subordinate Services Selection Commission (UKSSSC) graduate-level examination held on September 21, students across the State launched massive protests forcing the government to form an SIT under the chairmanship of a retired High Court judge to investigate the leak. The students, however, remained adamant for a CBI probe

title: Portal glitches and ‘missing records’ slow down registration of Waqf
content: The registration of Waqf properties is moving at a sluggish pace owing to website glitches and record challenges

title: Media should give Palestinians the chance to tell our story: Palestine Ambassador
content: Palestine solidarity meet held on the opening day of International Media Festival of Kerala organised by Kerala Media Academy

title: Rajnath Singh to Celebrate Vijayadashami with Soldiers in Bhuj
content: He will also travel to the forward post at Harami Nala near the India-Pakistan border to interact with the Army and BSF personnel.

title: Tibetan refugee injured during Ladakh protests, recovering in AIIMS ICU
content: A 21-year-old student of nursing in Bengaluru was airlifted from Leh on September 24 and admitted at the ICU in Jai Prakash Narayan Trauma Centre of AIIMS, New Delhi

title: Doctors stress importance of early diagnosis for full recovery in children with heart issues
content: Nutritional deficiencies or infections in mothers, less than two years of gap between two babies are some of the factors that influence heart disease risk in children, says a cardiologist during a heart health awareness programme organised by The Hindu  in association with Andhra Hospitals

title: U.S. tariffs will have long-term effect on trade: Commerce Ministry to PAC
content: Tariffs will significantly impact India’s marine exports, especially shrimp; Centre working on market diversification pushing for registration of more export units in the EU, and engaging in discussions with other countries, says Special Secretary

title: How Karur Medical College Hospital rose to the occasion during stampede tragedy
content: Inside the hospital, doctors, nurses and staff worked on a war footing. Nearly 85 doctors reported within hours of the incident, and about 90% of the hospital staff turned up without being summoned

title: Telangana’s 63-foot Bathukamma bursts into Guinness glory
content: Bathukamma festivities at Hyderabad’s Saroornagar Stadium makes history with two records — one for the largest floral goddess installation and another for a synchronised dance performance by more than 1,000 women

title: Tumakuru metro project moves a step closer to becoming a reality, says Parameshwara
content: The much-awaited Tumakuru metro project is inching closer to reality, Home Minister G. Parameshwara said

title: Apartment owners’ association bats for centralised sewer network in Kochi instead of individual STP units
content: Panel set up by the Kerala High Court will consider the association’s plea to resolve the issue by opting for a centralised network, especially in apartment complexes facing space constraints to install sewage treatment plants

title: TVK organisers deliberately delayed arrival of Vijay at Karur, claims FIR of Karur Town police
content: People who waited in large numbers for several hours without water and medical assistance experienced fatigue because of heat and crowding, which led to a stampede resulting in multiple deaths, says the FIR

title: Single-use plastic ban: municipalities in Ernakulam collect over ₹5 lakh as penalty this fiscal
content: Perumbavoor municipality has levied the highest penalty among the 13 municipalities, with enforcement squads collecting around ₹1.65 lakh

title: Kerala HC directs comprehensive inventory and expert evaluation of Sabarimala temple’s valuables
content: HC flays Travancore Devaswom Board for its alleged failure to maintain proper registers of valuables at the temple

title: PHC doctors announce suspension of OP, emergency services in State from September 30
content: Demand State government to increase the in-service quota in clinical departments from 15% to 20% as promised last year

title: BJP questions ‘silence’ of Congress, its allies on India’s victory over Pakistan in Asia Cup final
content: BJP MP Sudhanshu Trivedi says Opposition alliance, including Congress, is “always ready to side with Pakistan at every level, be it sports or diplomacy, and this is their true identity”

title: CM launches Citizen Connect Centre
content: The centre, established at Vellayambalam, will facilitate citizen feedback, grievances redressal, and public communication. The public can share their opinions, suggestions, and complaints through the toll-free number 1800-425-6789

title: Lorry drivers occupying right-most lane on NICE Road and highways spark safety concerns among commuters
content: Commuters say the practice not only slows traffic but also creates dangerous situations for smaller and faster vehicles attempting to overtake. Similar grievances are being reported on the Bengaluru–Mysuru expressway and the Nelamangala–Tumakuru highway

title: Krishna floods: over 100 families shifted to relief camps
content: We have arranged 22 boats at Thotlavallur mandal to shift the villagers in case of emergency, says Collector

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister presents silk robes to Goddess Kanaka Durga on Moola Nakshatram
content: Naidu reviews temple projects worth over ₹70 crore and assures that the 2027 Godavari Pushkarams and 2028 Krishna Pushkarams will be organised on a grand scale

title: Sports is a powerful unifying force, must not be a privilege of a few: Supreme Court
content: Sports and sporting bodies must be seen as institutions of ‘national life’; not only sports, but also its administration, must be accessible to the deserving, no matter what strata of society they hail from, the court says

title: A.P. CM calls for extensive campaigns to publicise benefits of GST rate cut
content: Chief Minister tells Ministers and officials to spread awareness among various sections of people by taking up sector-specific programmes till October 19, culminating in shopping festivals and cultural events

title: Ranking winners and losers, injury impacts from Sunday
content: RB, Las Vegas Raiders : Ashton Jeanty led all running backs through the late window on Sunday . he rushed for 138 yards and a touchdown on 21 carries, plus he added two receptions for 17 yards . the rookie could see a bump in pass game usage after his production .

title: 'Low power mode': Giants poke fun at Chargers, leading Week 4 trolls
content: the new york Giants beat the Los Angeles Chargers 21-18 at home . the Giants posted a photo of a broken phone charger with the caption: "low power mode" the Seattle Seahawks beat the Arizona Cardinals on "Thursday night football"

title: MLB wild-card round odds: The favorites for every series
content: the 2025 MLB playoffs kick off with the wild-card round . make your picks The two division winners in each league with the best records get a chance to rest their regulars and set up their rotations . each team's odds to win the series are accurate as of publish time .

title: Odisha Cabinet approves 10-hour shifts; allows night shifts for women

title: Joe Burrow-less Bengals prove no match for Broncos' elite defense
content: the Denver Broncos had lost back-to-back games heading into their prime-time matchup against the Cincinnati Bengals . the sun eventually popped out before kickoff and things looked much brighter for the home team . a defense that showed its elite potential once again, albeit against an offense without the injured Joe Burrow .

title: 🏀 LeBron future, Celtics' goals: Big NBA questions
content: despite 22 days separating the preseason from opening night, not every team's offseason storylines have been resolved . how will the saga trickle into the Golden State Warriors ' season; how the LA Clippers will handle the league's investigation into Kawhi Leonard . what are the expectations for the Indiana Pacers this season are just some of the largest stories to follow .

title: This year was supposed to be a Dodgers coronation; instead, it's an October crapshoot
content: the defending world Series champions had emerged from free agency with the best starter on the market, the best reliever on the marketplace and the best pitching prospect in the world . they were bound to be an all-time juggernaut, top to bottom, eons beyond any of their competitors . it wasn't 117, even if the number to set the game's single-game rotation was 117.

title: Dolphins' offense gets going, but Tyreek Hill's knee injury overshadows win over Jets
content: the Dolphins beat the new york Jets 27-21 on "Monday Night Football" it's a shocking injury to one of Miami's most durable players, not just because of its gruesome nature . only Justin Jefferson has more receiving yards than Hill since 2022 .

title: NBA media day 2025: KD's birthday wish and Jokic's jokes lead best moments
content: the new york Knicks, new Orleans pelicans, Brooklyn Nets , Phoenix Suns and Philadelphia 76ers were the first five teams to hold media days last week . the rest of the league's media days to Monday .

title: Power Rankings: LSU drops 13 spots; BYU, Memphis and Louisville join the Top 25
content: the first full month of the 2025 college football season is officially in the books . some of the nation's biggest early-season surprises were once again on display . despite a leaky run defense, Alabama notched its latest win over Georgia on the road .

title: Giants are cursed, Titans destined for another top pick? Overreacting to Week 4
content: the Falcons racked up 435 total yards in a 34-27 victory over the -less Commanders . a second-year QB Michael Penix Jr. followed the worst game of his young career with his best . the two teams fought valiantly against the Commanders and Marcus Mariota .

title: Phoenix reach the finals; Fever-Aces set for decider
content: the Phoenix Mercury beat the Lynx 86-81 to advance to the WNBA Finals . the team will play one more game to determine which team will face the Mercury . a controversial ending to Game 3 on friday was ejected .
